top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
It means the world sucks and is full of terrible people but I already knew that.

I am sick of this double standard. Had Hillary Clinton won it wouldn't have meant anything. She was expected to win. Biden wins and it means nothing despite him beating an incumbent. Democrats win the House and it means nothing because they should have won it by more. Democrats win the Senate majority and it means nothing because it just 50/50. No victory for Democrats is ever said to mean anything. When they win the victory is also dismissed as imperfect and underwhelming. 

Yet just the very thought of a Republican winning is staged as paradigm shifting. If Mcauliffe it won't be said to means shit. If Youngkin wins, OMG, Democrats are in trouble and Republicans are assured midterm victory!! It is ridiculous.

Among other things, it means nobody is asking Youngkin supporters why they think literal self-identifying Nazis support him. Seriously. I know everyone is all like "OMG tiki torch stunt!" but really this is something that everyone on the right needs to have an honest conversation with themselves about.

It doesn’t really mean that much and it doesn’t paint a moderate way forward for the GOP. Trump stayed out of this one race but he will not be able to stay out of every race in order to keep this model working if in fact it does work. Trump will not allow this model to work because it requires that he stay on the sidelines.
